description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the Windows Telephony Service remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-43635):

1. Download and apply the necessary update packages corresponding to your version of Windows.

   - For Windows 11 Version 24H2 for x64-based Systems, apply KB5046617 from the following link: [KB5046617](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5046617).

   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2 for x64-based Systems, apply KB5046633 from: [KB5046633](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5046633).

   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2 for x64-based Systems, apply KB5046613 from: [KB5046613](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5046613).

   - For Windows 10 for x64-based Systems, use KB5046665 from: [KB5046665](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5046665).

2. After installing the updates, restart your systems to ensure that the changes take effect.

**Details**:
- This series of updates resolves the remote code execution vulnerability impacting the Windows Telephony Service, which could potentially allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code. Ensure you are targeting the correct build number for your system to mitigate risks effectively.

**Preconditions**:
- The system should be running one of the Windows versions listed above.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the update installation.
